thread.title: Week 9: Friday night football’s fantastic five
thread.title_full: Week 9: Friday night football’s fantastic five

title: Week 9: Friday night football’s fantastic five
text:
Week 9: Friday night football’s fantastic five Here are the top five high school football games in the Mansfield area this week: Post to Facebook Week 9: Friday night football’s fantastic five Here are the top five high school football games in the Mansfield area this week: Check out this story on mansfieldnewsjournal.com: http://ohne.ws/1RWyXPT Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Rob McCurdy, Reporter 2:28 p.m. EDT October 21, 2015 Madison quarterback Tresten Vail attempts a pass against Orrville last week. The Rams travel to Ashland Friday night in a must-win game to stay in the hunt for an Ohio Cardinal Conference championship. (Photo: Lisa Bernheim/News Journal) 
Mansfield Senior 6-2, 4-1 OCC; Lexington 6-2, 3-2 OCC. 
• Last week: 
Mansfield Senior over Wooster 32-6; Lexington over West Holmes 42-0. 
• Tygers: 
Mansfield Senior is 11th in Division II, Region 5 ... Since allowing 25 points in a loss at Ashland, the Tygers’ defense has turned serious allowing just six points in the last two weeks ... Defensive end Mario Young has eight sacks this season, while Brian Benson leads them in tackles as a linebacker ... Benson is 17 yards shy of 1,000 for his season, and Tyquan Vickers had 683 yards on the ground ... The Tygers cut their penalties to four and did not turn the ball over last week at Wooster ... The team has 34 touchdowns this season. 
• Minutemen: 
Lexington is 11th in Division III, Region 8 ... The Minutemen snapped a two-game losing streak last week ... Lex has lost just one fumble this year ... Hunter Biddle leads with 796 rushing yards and seven touchdowns ... A.J. Nickoli is among the area’s leaders in receiving with 35 catches for 447 yards and three TDs ... Joey Vore has thrown for 804 yards while completing 52 percent of his passes ... The defense has allowed just 28 points in the fourth quarter of games ... Cade Stover went over the 100 tackle mark last week and now has 103. 
Madison at Ashland 
Madison 5-3, 4-1 OCC; Ashland 7-1, 4-1 OCC 
• Last week: 
Madison over Orrville 49-14; Ashland over Clear Fork 44-12. 
• Rams: 
Madison is 10th in Division III, Region 8 ... The Rams recorded 24 first downs last week, tied for the most they’ve posted this season ... Their 280 passing yards from Tresten Vail against Orrville was also a season-high ... Vail now has 1,303 yards passing with a 62 percent completion percentage ... Tyrell Ajian has 25 catches for 657 yards and 11 touchdowns, while Billy Buckley has 20 receptions for 368 yards and four more scores ... Ajian is the team’s ground leader with 437 yards for an average of 8.2 per carry. 
• Arrows: 
Ashland is sixth in Division III, Region 8 and controls its own playoff destiny ... Since a 21-7 loss to Wooster, the Arrows have scored 165 points or roughly 41 per game over the last four ... Lonzo Dampier paces the team with 788 yards rushing and 14 touchdowns, while quarterback Grant Denbow has scrambled for 403 yards ... Four players have caught at least 11 passes with John Wolfe leading with 32 receptions for 423 yards ... Senior defensive end Nivlek Lewis has eight sacks and two fumble recoveries. 
Shelby at Bellevue 
Shelby 5-3, 4-1 NOL; Bellevue 6-2, 4-0 NOL. 
• Last Week: 
Shelby over Ontario 46-13; Bellevue over Willard 60-7. 
• Whippets: 
Shelby is 11th in Division IV, Region 13 ... The Whippets are averaging 29 of their 35 points per game in the first half ... Shelby has scored 46 points in each of the last three weeks ... Brennan Armstrong is the top passer in the Northern Ohio League with 1,230 yards on 69 of 140 passing ... He has thrown for 13 touchdowns and ran for 15 more ... Derek Rose and Dillon Thornsberry rank 1-2 in the league with 5.5 and four sacks each. 
• Redmen: 
Bellevue is 10th in Division IV, Region 12 ... The Redmen are the highest scoring team in the NOL, averaging 36.5 points, while also giving up a league-best 16.1 points per game ... Alec Foos is the top runner in the NOL with 1,254 yards on 183 carries and 17 touchdowns ... Foos also has completed 51 of 88 passes for 840 yards and 11 more TDs and just two interceptions ... Three defensive linemen for the Redmen have three sacks each. 
Lucas at Danville 
Lucas 8-0, 2-0 MBC; Danville 8-0, 2-0 MBC. 
• Last week: 
Lucas over Bridgeport 48-0; Danville over Loudonville 49-6. 
• Cubs: 
According to JoeEitel.com, Lucas has already clinched a playoff berth in Division VII, Region 24 ... The Cubs are ranked No. 2 in the latest AP state poll ... They have allowed no more than 14 points in a game this season and shut out three teams ... Mason Galco paces the squad with 1,382 yards and 20 touchdowns, averaging 8.1 yards per carry ... Jackson Hauger averages 14.5 yards and Jeb Grover 7.1 yards per carry ... Rueben Luna has kicked 34 of 43 extra points and is 1-for-1 in field goal attempts ... Ryan Cook is the tackling leader with 77, while Galco has seven sacks and nine tackles for loss. 
• Blue Devils: 
Danville is ranked No. 1 in Division VII in the AP state poll ... The Blue Devils are second in Region 25, but control their own playoff destiny ... Loudonville scored six points on Danville last week and that was the first points allowed since Week 2 ... Ridge “Shakey” Durbin is the senior quarterback and defensive end who stands 6-foot-2 and weighs 230 pounds Against Loudonville, Durbin rushed for three TDs and threw for two others ... Coach Ed Honabarger went over 100 wins in 12 seasons earlier this year. 
Highland at Cardington 
Highland 5-3, 5-0 MOAC Blue; Cardington 6-2, 4-1 MOAC Blue. 
• Last week: 
Highland over Fredericktown 49-14; Cardington over East Knox 54-8. 
• Scots: 
Highland is 13th in Division IV, Region 12 ... The Scots rebounded from three straight losses to start the year and are riding a five-game winning streak to lead the Mid Ohio Athletic Conference, Blue Division standings ... Jared Limings went over 1,000 yards rushing with a 209-yard effort in last weeks blowout of Fredericktown ... He has 14 touchdowns ... Max Schreiber is 32-for-60 for 512 yards passing ... Dylan Tuggle has 14 catches for 128 yards to lead the Scots ... Zach Baker is the team’s leader in tackles. 
• Pirates: 
Cardington is 12th in Division VI, Region 21 ... The Pirates have won three in a row and six of their last seven ... Luke McCarrell is having a standout season at QB with an area-best 1,628 yards on 78 of 134 passing, throwing for 21 touchdowns and just four interceptions ... Devin Pearl is a top target with 24 catches and 809 yards with 11 TDs ... Daniel Kill has 12 touchdowns with seven on the ground and five in the air ... Brock Shade has recorded 5.5 sacks to lead the team, adding 9.5 tackles for loss. 
Rob McCurdy is a sports writer at the News Journal and can be reached at rmccurdy@gannett.com or 419-521-7241. On Twitter follow @McMotorsport. Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1RWyXPT MORE STORIES
